p: Microbial processes other than heterotrophic denitrification can contribute to N removal in the STA, including N 2O production from nitrification [ 44], N 2 production from anaerobic ammonia oxidation [ 45], and N 2 production from autotrophic denitrification [ 46, 47]. We have shown evidence for the occurrence of these processes in the STA [ 43]. Lower available O 2 ( Fig 3) due to warmer and wetter conditions under CC would be expected to favor N removal by both autotrophic and heterotrophic processes in all three STAs. However CC may have impacted heterotrophic N removal negatively due to organic carbon limitations in shallow narrow STAs.
